results.title: News hounds
results.creator_credit: Leslie Blair, Sarah Curtis, BBC Film Unit and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: A satiric look at the world of tabloid journalism in Britain. ‘The Brit’ is a muckraking tabloid newspaper that will stop at nothing in its thirst for scandal. The way the paper constructs its front page expose of two sex-scandal stories that emerge on the same day - one involving a cabinet minister and the other a soapie star - reveals much about the state of journalism and politics in England at the end of the eighties. (Awards: British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) Award for Best Single Television Drama, 1990). Cast includes Adrian Edmondson, Alison Steadman, Linda Bassett and Christopher Fulford.

results.title: News digest [No. 5]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Demonstrates the usefulness of a helicopter for fire-spotting, and foam for extinguishing a car fire; Streeton’s descendants open his old home to the public, show many paintings; Latrobe Valley Aero Club caters for country flyers; at Harcourt an old sailor remembers the past as he models sailing ships.

results.title: News
results.creator_credit: Tim King, Mike Wooller and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how the news is gathered and presented on the 9 o’clock news on BBC1, including the build-up of tension among the team when making time and location checks. Great “bird’s-eye” view of the news team.

results.title: Newfoundland scene: a tale of outport adventure (D)
results.brief_description: NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF THE SLAUGHTER OF BABY SEALS. A study of Newfoundland’s natural resources and primary industry. Cod fishing, sealing and whaling are the focus of this documentary. Also looked at is transportation by Eskimo sled. Includes scenes of Labrador Retrievers, a malemute dog sled team mutinying against its leader causing injfires, the light from a lighthouse and a Newfoundland outport wharf in the misty dawn. (Awards: Canadian Film Award, 1951)

results.title: New Zealand: the land and it's people
results.brief_description: Classroom film depicting a trip through New Zealand’s North and South Islands with scenes showing that this country of mountains, forests and grasslands is a modern nation whose people share many of the customs of all English-speaking people. Includes views of the livestock and dairying industries, the busy port cities, and the activities and recreation of the people of both European and Maori ancestry.

results.title: New Zealand Weekly Review. No. 293. Culture: music and children
results.brief_description: Introduces the New Zealand National Symphony Orchestra and the special children’s concerts given to stimulate an interest in music. At one performance, students hear the Orchestra’s rendition of “Fingal’s Cave Overture” and “Handel in the Strand” followed by a short explanation by conductor Anderson Tyers.

results.title: New Zealand Mirror. No. 50. Our neighbour the sea
results.brief_description: The sea in New Zealand life. Diving for shell-fish; making paua shell jewellery; sailing; trawling and other types of fishing, including big-game; boatbuilding; life-saving carnivals; water-skiing; family beach parties.
